value.title: Ask a question with the new Q&A visual in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Justyna joins us to show the new Q&A visual in Power BI Desktop. Easily ask a question and tune results in this awesome update.  Connect with Justyna: Twitter: https://twitter.com/JustynaLucznik  Guy in a Cube courses: https://guyinacu.be/courses  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube

value.title: Azure Active Directory and Power BI
value.excerpt: I take a look at how Power BI and Azure Active Directory interact.  Really it is more about Azure Active Directory and how do you get users into AAD.  This came up as I get pinged a lot from folks wondering how they can use AAD with Power BI, not necessarily realizing that it is already there.  http://blogs.technet.com/b/powerbisupport/archive/2015/09/15/azure-active-directory-and-power-bi.aspx

value.title: Column Profiling in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Adam walks through column profiling within the Power BI Desktop. This includes the latest updates with the general availability (GA) within the April 2019 Power BI Desktop release.  Demo files: https://guyinacu.be/demofiles  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton

value.title: Configure Kerberos for Power BI reports in Reporting Services
value.excerpt: I walk through how to configure Kerberos to get Power BI reports within SQL Server Reporting Services running in a distributed environment. This means Analysis Services is not on the same machine as Reporting Services.  I start by showing how to configure the data source with a stored credential and
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/vCH8Fa3OpQ0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Copy Conditional Columns in Power Query or Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how to use conditional columns within Power Query and then copying them for use in other queries or Power BI Desktop files. This is a great technique if you don't want to retype all of the conditional items in the dialog in Power BI.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com

images.title: Copy Conditional Columns in Power Query or Power BI

value.title: Create a Power BI app registration in 6 steps
value.excerpt: We look at a Power BI tutorial on how to properly complete the app registration within Azure Active Directory (AAD). This power bi tutorial is needed as we see many questions about the proper configuration for a Power BI app registration regarding which settings to use.  App registrations are needed

value.title: Fuzzy match / merging in Power BI Desktop (October 2018)
value.excerpt: In this video, we look at the new fuzzy match / merging option within the October 2018 version of Power BI Desktop. This feature is incredibly powerful when it comes to data matching and can be adjusted to meet your needs.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube

value.title: How to use the Power BI Aggregations Feature
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam sits down with Christian Wade to discuss how to use the Power BI Aggregations feature. This video will show you the clicks to get to the clicky clicky draggy droppy awesomeness when working with big data, or even massive data.   Christian Wade on Twitter - @_christianWade  LET'S CONNECT!

value.excerpt: We reduced a Power BI dataset size by 83% by doing one simple thing. It's time to get serious about your data model! value.title: Mark as Date Table in Power BI Desktop is here!
value.excerpt: Mark as Date Table in Power BI Desktop is finally here! In this video, Patrick takes what Adam did with a custom date table and shows you how you can use Mark as Date Table in Power BI Desktop. This feature was introduced in the February 2018 release of Power BI Desktop. Mark as Date Table has been available

value.title: Microsoft R, Data Science and Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, we are joined by Buck Woody. Buck is a data scientist at Microsoft. We work together to show how you can easily visualize Microsoft R in Power BI. We use Microsoft R Open and then move onto Power BI Desktop.  The example used in Microsoft R Open is the Anscombe's quartet.   Download sample

value.title: Native Query: Be careful when using in Power BI
value.excerpt: Patrick looks at native query and why you should be careful when using it in Power BI. He looks at what native query is, what to consider when using it, and how to monitor what query folding, in Power Query, is or is not doing.  Guy in a Cube Courses: https://guyinacu.be/courses  ******** LET'S CONNECT!

value.title: Power BI Desktop And Role-Playing Dimensions: Can you do it?
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick talks about Power BI Desktop and role-playing dimensions. Can you even do this in Power BI Desktop? Patrick shows you why one particular way is not recommended as it will cause trouble. And then show you how you can use DAX within Power BI Desktop to take this to the next level.

value.excerpt: Have you wondered how to find the native query in Power BI Desktop after query folding does its thing? Do you even know what query folding is? In this video, Adam looks at how you can find the query that will be sent to your data source and a few things to be aware of. This applies to Power Query in

value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Visualizing Data
value.excerpt: Paginated reports in Power BI are now available. Now that you have data, Patrick walks you through how to build a matrix visual within the report. He also looks at how to work with expressions and formatting.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube --

value.title: Power BI parameters - Updating in the Power BI Service or with APIs
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how you can update Power BI parameters within the service or by using APIs. You can create Power BI Parameters within Power BI Desktop using Power Query. Then you can update those Power BI parameters once the report is published to the Power BI service.  PowerShell Samples:
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/MJVSu47iMmo" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI PowerShell and the Admin API
value.excerpt: The Power BI PowerShell and the Admin API allow you to quickly inventory your organization and manage workspaces and access. Forget the hastle of setting up the App registration within Azure Active Directory for API access, the Power BI PowerShell cmdlets take care of it for you. Just install and start

value.title: Power BI User lookup with the gateway using Active Directory
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how you can use Active Directory custom attributes for the user lookup with the Power BI Gateway. This can be used for both Analysis Services mapping and the Kerberos SSO with DirectQuery connections.  Manage your data source - Analysis Services https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/service-gateway-enterprise-manage-ssas#usernames-with-analysis-services

value.title: Publish to Web got some awesome new updates in Power BI!

value.title: Report level measures with Power BI live connections

value.title: Tooltips, tooltips, tooltips in Power BI

value.title: Using DAX to format a list of values in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Alberto Ferrari joins Patrick to walk through how you can use DAX to format a list of values within Power BI Desktop. This takes the concatenate values quick measure to the next level.  Original Quick Measure video - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SjSKCZtiNlI  Alberto's article - https://www.sqlbi.com/blog/alberto/2018/12/20/displaying-a-list-of-selected-months/

value.title: Using different languages with the Power BI site
value.excerpt: I look at how your browser languages affect what is displayed. This all comes down to your browsers and the language settings within. Different browsers are configured differently. Fiddler can show you what your language order is.  SUBSCRIBE! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFp1vaKzpfvoGai0vE5VJ0w?sub_confirmation=1

value.title: Visualize Graph Data in Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you wondered how to visualize graph data? No, not Microsoft Graph. Graph Networks! Adam shows you how you can do this in Power BI Desktop.  Download sample: http://guyinacu.be/graphdatasample  Microsoft Graph API: https://docs.microsoft.com/graph/overview  Graphs and Networks https://www.mathworks.com/help/matlab/graph-and-network-algorithms.html
